intro: Cascarilla carua, commonly known as the golden root, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and Central America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its yellow-orange roots, which are the primary source of its medicinal and aromatic properties. Its leaves are opposite and elliptical, with a glossy surface, while its flowers are small and white, often clustered in inflorescences. The roots are harvested for their essential oils and have been used in traditional medicine for their anti-inflammatory and analgesic effects.
